topic.title: shutting down zites? right....
topic.body: I dont know who this foreign actor is typing in japanese here- but good luck with the idea....this is designed explicity to NOT be taken down- as a "free" and "democratic" "republic" or "federated" as it were internet. So take your kp and leave it at home. Take your drug dealing and leave it at home, most of us dont want you here. everything else, I find is fair game. It wouldnt suprise me if NK is using zero but Kim needs to behave or go. I didnt like NK missile antics in 06 and I dont like them now. That said, if the people want to come here(zero), I have no problem. The idea of zero is decentralized. Only the bitcoin part could ever be, and recent coins are masking and preventing even that(cryptonote).The more fair a coin is to mine(machinecoin), the more decentralized in my book that it can be. Wrong coin, maybe but- bit is the leader and easier to get right now. And it seems that may be changing.

topic.title: kicking the jsons once a while
topic.body: im noticing that kicking the json in the pants once and a while seems to work out bugs in distribution...go and change something, save it, then sync..

topic.title: anyone need nmc blockchain?
topic.body: i might have to get some discs first but I have the blocks. it makes resolving sooo much easier. I know syntax too...just copy the formulae with your zite address instead of mine. nmc payments are like piss and really we need more nodes up..

topic.title: bad peers
topic.body: is anyone else getting bad peers or peers using random ports other than what they should? what causes this? I thought 0net was strictly 15441. also explodie tracker is down.

topic.title: inbreed stupid or a case of airline abuse?
topic.body:
anyone catching this headline?: florida female told to flush hamster(little fluffy thing) as emo support animal. FOXNEWS says she did it.

fisrt of all- any airline (emo support or otherwise) telling me I cant fly with a hedgehog- a CARRY-ON ITEM and charging me an extra $150 for said carry-on is getting a dose of thier supervisor. 

secondly- you refuse..I dont care if its a non refundable ticket...your comping my ticket back.
thirdly- ill never fly w you again. I put my money where my mouth is.

but the audacity of airlines to even ask such atrocious actions should be no less than investigated by secret service, FBI, and ASPCA agents. so who gets the creulty chrage- the airline or the AHEM.. dyke?

clearly if your that stupid to go along with a WRONGFUL ORDER of another you didnt deserve the thing anyhoo. This said- this is beyond wrong.

airlines have been taking advantage of people trying to fly w loved ones just to make a buck. THEY decided that wo a emo support ticket that persons not having dogs or cats- which are more problems- and limited at that to 5 per flight--- was needed.

so people went hog wild, I take it but...this is INSANE! as if the peacock wasnt bad enough..airlines are blaming bad patrons YET AGAIN!

and a hedgehog isnt a rodent. Its an insectivore.
southernhedgehogs.bit or .org.

I had issues with southwest in long island. never flew with them since. never will again until policy changes.

topic.title: just me or is contents json being a uknowwhat?
topic.body: its supposed to autoscan and hash-if you have msgpack installed(nice depends issue there) and supposedly works but I keep getting live errors when browsing stating contents.json is detecting missing files(moved or removed files). if contents.json is supposed to rescan-a its not doing thru the web interface and b- imgetting old errors for some reason. we shouldnt have to edit this file by hand.

If you cant graduate from h8- GET LOST. HITLER LOST, the VRIL will get whats theirs. END OF STORY.

topic.title: removing bigots
topic.body: there is horrendous influx of bigots and hate groups- even infecting other peoples UNRELATED posts. THIS NEEDS TO STOP- and we need a way to stop it.

topic.title: ZeroGIt at GitCenter
topic.body:
doesnt the format of this presume that we need others to publish - a big problem when first starting out? This is why we started 0List and mirroring other peoples zites...problem rears its ugly head again- you cant publish a git repo until someone comes along and mirrors you.

Anyone need Lazarus/fpc graphix libs? working on pulling the code up here. Builds. src is WIP. Uses SDL1 and 2. Partial GL help for LAzarus.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1ChucjfZdweRfaBvXPi6aaZWExZVMRjvkb@master

and can someone tell me how banned coins such as name- can be bought /xferred to pay for domains? maybe we need to enable independent cpu mining of name- (or some other coin)? Its fine if you have a domain- but what if you want a new one?

topic.title: 0Net windows vs...
topic.body: Is it jsut me- or has 0net taken a hit lately? usually I see more peers on nix vs windows...lately not only that but meerNodes are needed to sync yall(your) zites-- and were showing ZERO tracker sync repeatedly, an ongoing issue. I dont know who implemented this- but we need to push for trackerLESS states--peers can be compromised or attacked, or unreachable. If anyone else is seeing this, please report it to the devs. Im on Win10 atm, I usually use Debian/ubuntu.

topic.title: Windows glitches
topic.body:
specifically to 0net- Im finding the following glitches remain:
Private key not released to user for syncing. Now it becomes stored somewhere on zite creation..but where? Users will need this data--data can only be provided to us it seems - from a commandLET shell window---but theres not commandLET-python libraries are here...but no python script either,its an EXE file. This is wrong. Users should have a similar experience on all OSes.

Its the shell scrypt that spews out the private keys on creation--but theres no script to run. If one transfered OSes- your private keys would get lost somewhere on windows. Youd be locked out of future edits.

meek/meer trackerless is required on windows(maybe its my shitty spectrum lines but...)
Tor is some effort as well but it does work on windows- most of the traffic seems to be on tor.

(those complaining about hosts(0 peers)- post to the new zite blog and background the process for a few hours so we can see you. we cant mirror what we dont see...anyone worth a damn is tracking new zites..cmon, be fair to others...theyre hosting YOU...)

You could go into there and change it manually and then publish it that way. Have had to do that with a few sites on here since some places just have a post and no edit option.

does work removing your own zite either. You lose the domain , if you bought one- now people are swarming to a non existant zite. Editing the json file doesnt work.

1620417095_17ufjt7e9DRsavS6AADWoGpiutSp8.body:
> [xcape2net](#comment_853_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): True.  However, as recent events have highlighted, what the NSA has today, Internet thieves will have tomorrow.  And we really have no way of knowing what they have until they have possibly had it for years.  This is a complicated issue.  I feel that Truecypt is still the safest way to go, but if you want to chose Veracrypt, who am I to dissuade you.

Vera fix es few holes in the logic- it doesnt fix stupidity in storing data. Your data leaks everywhere- the OS, the HDD spare sectors...and most people dont encrypt CDROM data(it can be done). Physical access always means hosed/compromised. Stay on decent part of the net- update only thru trusted sources- youll mostly be fine. TC has never been cracked- theres a few password hash weaknesses, some are addressed in VC. Setup aes-si cpu instructions if you need speed but you need more modern computer- TC can run on older macs(7.0), nix, windows.GOST is an option but windows flags the subdriver. Bitlocker suffers from a manufacturer bug when drives can be decrypted easily- thats why msft switched to software implementation(force it on)- linux can piss thru the encryption it seems(ive not tested but people claim to be able unlocker drives). Same with TM encryption on mac. Id trust TC/VC/GOST more than anything that ships with the OS.
